title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. During control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures. No funds can be obligated or spent by District of Columbia government officials unless authorized by the budget. After the annual budget is adopted, reprogramming of funds requires approval from the Mayor and Council, with any additional expenditures offset by reductions in other activities. A 'control year' is defined as per section 305(4) of the District of Columbia. The term 'control year' is defined in section 305(4) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Amendments to the Congressional Review Period for Budget Acts include a new paragraph stating that Acts not in a control year take effect after a 30-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted. The Congressional Review Period for Budget Acts allows for a 30-day period for a joint resolution to disapprove an Act. If the resolution passes both Houses of Congress and is transmitted to the President within this period, the Act will be repealed upon the resolution becoming law. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act, including 475(e)(2), 483(d), and subsections (f), (g)(3), (h)(3), and (i)(3) of section 490 by replacing references to "The fourth sentence of section 446" with "Section 446(c)". Additionally, changes are made to section 412(a) and section 202(c)(2) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The Government Improvement Act of 1997 is amended by replacing references to "the fourth sentence of section 446" with "section 446(c)". The item in the table of contents related to section 446 is also updated. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. SEC. 4. Amends Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow for incorporation of items or provisions in budget acts. Defines "control year" in relation to the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Allows for hiring of employees if position is authorized by Act of the Council. SEC. 4 amends Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to permit employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. SEC. 5 makes amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the federal authority over the budget-making process during control years. It restricts the approval of budgets that are not consistent with the financial plan established under the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6 states that any general provision in an appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7 specifies that the amendments apply to the District of Columbia budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
